post.summary: Logs in the user with a username/ password and returns a JWT and refresh token.
Logs in the user with just a username and returns a JWT and refresh token.
Using a refresh token, get a new JWT.
Allows authentication via legacy EmHub/ AzureAD system.

get.summary: When authenticated via an external IDP for SSO, the authentication service will return  a short-lived cookie called SsoToken that can be used to fetch a valid JWT and refresh  token from the system.

post.summary: Schedules new User Management Change Logs job.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Start date of the reporting period.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: End date of the reporting period.

get.summary: Lists accounts in the system with some rudimentary searching and sorting functionality.

put.summary: Updates the specified account with the provided metadata.

post.summary: Creates a new account in the system.
Links customer and legacy account.  This endpoint is mainly used by AuthSync process, when new customer and account are created.

patch.summary: Enables access contexts for the customer.
Disables access contexts for the customer.

get.summary: Determines if access contexts are enabled for specified customer.
Get information for a customer. Used by the  client service.
List of eligible accounts for impersonation
Gets a list of user details for a given customer for Impersonation.  <param name="customerId">Identifier of the customer.</param><param name="search"></param>

post.summary: Provides an access token to act on behal of the impersonated user.

get.summary: Lists all licensed modules for the specified customer (account)

post.summary: Sets/ creates the licensing for a module for the specified customer (account)
Allows a previously non-existent user to register with a new account, mainly used  to sign up for a free trial.
If the username currently exists in our data store, return true.  Otherwise, return false.
If the company name currently exists in our data store, return true.  Otherwise, return false.
With the provided token and new password, allows a user to set/ create their password.  This will also set their account as having their email address confirmed.
With the provided old and new passwords, allows a user to change their password.
Registers a coworker at the same company as the authenticated user.  If the user's token  has expired, you can "re-register" the user using this method to generate a new token.
Returns the company credential used for legacy operations within the Access Analyzer,  encrypted with the provided shared secret key.  This communication should always go over TLS.

get.summary: Returns legacy account identifier by provided customer identifier, for a service account
Gets identifier of customer by its legacy ID, for a service account
Generates PasswordReset token for specified user.
Entry point for SAML2 SSO authentication.  If the OID is registered in the system, should redirect  the user to the registered IDP for authentication.

parameters.name: oid
parameters.description: The object id of the SSO client.  For example, if the SSO client hits https://foo.erpmaestro.com/sso,              the oid would be "foo".

post.summary: Creates a reference to an external identity provider for the SAML2 protocol.  Only one external  identity provider can be used per customer.

patch.summary: Modify/ update a previously registered SAML2 SSO IDP.

delete.summary: Permanently removes a registered SAML2 SSO IDP.  This should only be used when changing the IDP  for the customer to something else, otherwise disable the IDP via M:ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Controllers.SsoController.ModifySaml2IdentityProvider(ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Client.Models.ModifySaml2IdentityProviderModel).

post.summary: Associates a user with a customer's IDP and allows the claim type to be  specified or updates a previous association.  Tenancy checking is NOT performed  in the authentication service; this should be done before the service calls the endpoint.

delete.summary: Removes an association of an SSO user from a customer.

post.summary: Allows a system admin to register a previously non-existent user with a new account.  Mainly used for ARM free trials.

patch.summary: Allows a system admin to confirm a user's email.

post.summary: Adds EmHub user information to Auth Service.
Updates user information from EmHub.
Updates user password by information from EmHub.

get.summary: Returns legacy account identifier by provided customer identifier
Gets identifier of customer by its legacy ID.

post.summary: Determines if user belongs to any of specified customers.

Creates a new user in the system under the specified customer (account).  Note that this does not set a password for the account.  Please see the associated endpoint   for setting a password for a user.
Confirms the email and sets a user's password.

get.summary: Requests a password reset.

post.summary: Changes password using Reset token.
Changes the password for the current user.
Changes the password for the specified sysJob user.

get.summary: Get a user from the system by id.

parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The id of the user to be deleted.

get.summary: Gets the assigned customers for the specified user.

parameters.description: The username of the user in question.

Gets the current user.
Gets the current customers

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user.

get.summary: Get a user from the system by username.
Get a user from the system by username.

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the customer.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of users assigned to the specified account.
Checks if user is a service user. Mainly serves Gaia to EmHub communication,   to be able to validate the user account is service account while performing sync.

post.summary: Updates isSysAdmin permission of provided user.
Adds new relationship between user and customer. Allows change "IsAdmin" flag for existing relationship.
Updates relationship between user and customer.
Removes relationship between user and customer.

get.summary: Exports users for specified customer.

post.summary: Schedules new job to import users.

get.summary: Gets Customer to User Roles list

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Core.M.description: Response including an authentication token and a refresh token

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Models.description: Model used to login only using a username. This should only be used by service accounts.

username.description: Username of the user logging in.

isEamLogin.description: Flag to tell the system whether or not this is an EAM login.

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Client.description: Metadata associated with a Refresh Token

serializedAuthenticationMetadata.description: If ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Models.Customer.AccountModel.AuthenticationMethod is set to ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Core.Models.AuthenticationMethods.OnPremisesCustom, this  property should contain a JSON  document with the metadata necessary to connect to the custom authentication service.  This is ignored if the  ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Models.Customer.AccountModel.AuthenticationMethod  is set to a different value.

moduleGracePeriod.description: The number of days that the modules for this account may exceed their license expiration before becoming inactive.

minimumUsers.description: This is currently not used except to give a floor for licensed users.

maximumUsers.description: Maximum users in system to be licensed.  Note: This is not enforced through automated means.

accessContextsEnabled.description: Determines if Access Context enabled for customer.

externalId.description: The external unique identifier for a given entity.  For example, this id would be a match between us and the CRM provider.  (E.g.: SFDC company id - 0011a000003rd4TAAQ)

externalIdType.description: The external unique identifier type for the entity id in ExternalId.  (E.g.: SFDC, IBM, Oracle, etc.)

accessContextsEnabled.description: Determines if Access Context enabled for customer.

hasApiAccess.description: Serves as a flag that determines if the user-at-customer has api access.

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Core.M.description: External Identity Providers (IDPs) are used to support Single Signon (SSO) for a customer's enterprise.  In this manner, the customer can manage their own users from their own systems, and we can trust their  systems to authenticate their users properly.

key.description: The Key represents a unique identifier that is externally referenced for a specific IDP.  For example, if someone is connecting to https://foo.erpmaestro.com using SSO, the Key  should be "foo".

entityId.description: The unique name the IDP identifies itself as, almost always a URL.

metadata.description: Metadata contain the contents or link to contents of metadata necessary to properly authenticate  against the external IDP.  If the ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Core.Models.ExternalIdentityProvider.MetadataType is of type ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Client.Models.MetadataType.Url, this  should be a fully-qualified URL pointing to the metadata file.  If it's of type ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Client.Models.MetadataType.Xml,  the contents of this property should contain the XML of the metadata itself.

claimType.description: The claim type that can be referenced when trying to match a user to an external IDP source.  Each IDP, upon  authenticating a user, will return a list of claims for that authenticated user.  One or more of them may be  suitable for matching against their username in the authentication service, but only one can be chosen for any  authenticated assertion.

customerId.description: Customer ID for the customer that uses this IDP.

enabled.description: Only enabled IDPs can be used to authenticate.

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Core.M.description: Represents a user setting that is specific per customer user belongs to

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Client.description: Used to display user details including SSO names in the user management UI.

username.description: If left blank, the ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Client.Models.V2.UserDetailsModel.Email property will be used.

ssoName.description: Represents the user's single sign on name.

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Models.description: Model that represents a license for a customer (account) to use a specific module.

customerId.description: The account Id in the auth/license system.

expires.description: The expiration date of the licensed module.

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Models.description: Model that represents a license for a customer (account) to use a specific module.

expires.description: The expiration date of the licensed module.

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Models.description: Used to register new system participants.

companyName.description: Name of the company user is registering for

companyId.description: The external unique identifier for the company in question.  This id should be a match between us and the CRM provider.  (E.g.: SFDC company id - 0011a000003rd4TAAQ)

companyIdType.description: The type of the external unique identifier for the company in question.  (E.g.: SFDC, IBM, Oracle, etc.)

email.description: Unique email address of the user

title.description: Optional title of user at the company

phone.description: Optional phone number of user at the company

minUsers.description: Minimum number of users in company's system

maxUsers.description: Maximum number of users in company's system

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Models.description: Model used for setting a user's password

newPassword.description: The new password to be set

token.description: The reset token sent to the user's email address.  The token contains the username.

newPassword.description: The new password to be set

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Models.description: Metadata required to register a coworker.

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Client.description: Used to register a SAML2 External Identity Provider (IDP)  for a given customer.

key.description: The "short" vanity name that can identify the provider.  If the customer were to connect to "https://foo.erpmaestro.com" for SSO,  the ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Client.Models.CreateSaml2IdentityProviderModel.Key would be "foo".  Must be unique.

entityId.description: The unique entity id for the remote IDP.  Usually this is in the form of "https://some.url/some/path".  Must be unique.

metadata.description: For SAML2, this contains either an XML metadata document, or a URL that resolves to an XML metadata document.  The contents should be specified by the ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Client.Models.CreateSaml2IdentityProviderModel.MetadataType property.

claimType.description: Specifies the claim type that will be matched in the SAML2 response assertion to determine who the response assertion  is meant to authenticate.

customerId.description: Relates the external IDP to a specific customer.  Only one IDP can exist per customer, and only one customer can have a  specific IDP.

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Client.description: Used to modify an existing SAML2 IDP.

identityProviderId.description: The unique id of the IDP.

key.description: The "short" vanity name that can identify the provider.  If the customer were to connect to "https://foo.erpmaestro.com" for SSO,  the ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Client.Models.ModifySaml2IdentityProviderModel.Key would be "foo".  Must be unique.

entityId.description: The unique entity id for the remote IDP.  Usually this is in the form of "https://some.url/some/path".  Must be unique.

metadata.description: For SAML2, this contains either an XML metadata document, or a URL that resolves to an XML metadata document.  The contents should be specified by the ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Client.Models.ModifySaml2IdentityProviderModel.MetadataType property.

claimType.description: Specifies the claim type that will be matched in the SAML2 response assertion to determine who the response assertion  is meant to authenticate.

isEnabled.description: Set to false to disable authentication via this IDP.

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Client.description: Used to create and modify SSO User settings for customer IDPs.  A user can have zero or one associations with any given IDP,  provided he/she is associated with the related customer.

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Models.description: Used to confirm a new user's email after registration

username.description: Represents the unique email address of the user.

emailConfirmed.description: Represents a value indicating whether the user's email has been confirmed.

erpUserId.description: Represents identifier of related ERP user.

roleNames.description: Represents a collection of assigned roles.

username.description: If left blank, the ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Client.AuthenticatedClient.EmHub.EmHubChangePasswordModel.Email property will be used.

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Client.description: Used to view/create/update users in the system.

username.description: If left blank, the ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Client.Models.UserModel.Email property will be used.

identityProviderConfigured.description: Determines if identity provider is configured for selected customer.

roleIds.description: Represents a collection of assigned role ids.

userSettings.description: Represents a collection of user settings.

isActive.description: Represents a value indicating whether the user is an active user.

preferredLanguage.description: Represents the code of the user's preferred language.

isService.description: Represents a value indicating whether the user is a service user.

createdUtcTimestamp.description: Represents the date and time the user was created.

lastModifiedBy.description: Represents the user that last modified the record.

lastModifiedUtcTimestamp.description: Represents the date and time the user was updated.

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Models.description: Model containing the necessary parameters to change a user's password.

userId.description: The ID of user customer associated with.

customerId.description: The ID of customer user associated with.

isAdmin.description: Determines that user is admin for specified customer. As a result, user can manage other users for the customer.

ErpMaestro.AuthenticationServices.Core.M.description: Represents the relationship between customers, users and user roles.

customerId.description: The unique identifier of the customer.

userId.description: The unique identifier of the user.

roleId.description: The unique identifier of the role.

roleCreatedUtcTimestamp.description: Represents the date and time the role was created.

roleLastModifiedBy.description: Represents the user who last modified the role.

roleLastModifiedUtcTimestamp.description: Represents the date and time the role was last modified.
